result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Lynn Cyr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca Lynn Cyr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Sam Joseph Filippo in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rebecca Lynn Cyr appeared by phone means.   DA calls 16CF22 and 16CM50 at 10:36 a.m.  Cites appearances.  DA states agreement.  Def pleads NC to Count 3 and 4 in 16CF22 and to sole Count in 16CM50.  Sentence to be $25 fine plus costs.  Credit for 8 months in residential treatment so no further jail.  Atty Filippo agrees as stated.  Court accepts pleas and finds guilty.  Imposes $25 plus costs on Count #3 in 16CF22.  DNA sample to be given, surcharge imposes.  Also 8 months in Iron County jail with credit for all time served.  No further jail requirement.  $484.50 is total obligation to be paid at $10 per month.  No other sentence on 16CM50 or Count #4.  Adj.  10:41 a.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Sam J. Filippo appeared on behalf of def who was not present.  Matthew J. Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 12:15 p.m.  Requests case to be rescheduled in 30 days.  Sam concurs.  Court accepts request for continuance.  Adj. 12:17 p.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Rebecca Lynn Cyr in court with attorney Sam Joseph Filippo.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing and reading of the complaint.  Court accepts waiver and preserves right to prelim but waives time limits.  PTC to be scheduled.  Bond is now an omnibus bond for both cases.  Court is acceptible to making changes to bond if needed to allow def to go to treatment.  Defendant also pleads NG to all misdemeanor charges.  klr
